intro: Spathyema foetida f. latissima, commonly known as the broad-leaved stinkweed, is a variant of the stinkweed plant characterized by its wide, flat leaves. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is native to southern Africa and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. However, it is important to note that the plant can be toxic if ingested in large quantities.
